## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Steven BOUCINO v. Lawrence TILLMAN, Warden, Somers Prison
**판결일**: 1992-03-17
**법원**: District Court, D. Connecticut
**관할**: Connecticut, CT

**판사**: Margolis

## 변호인

James J. Ruane, Bridgeport, CT, for plaintiff., Julia DiCocco Dewey, Asst. State’s Atty., Wallingford, CT, for defendant.

## 인용

- 807 F. Supp. 222

## 판결문 요약


RECOMMENDED RULING ON CROSS-MOTIONS FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT
MARGOLIS, United States Magistrate Judge.
On January 10, 1991, petitioner Steven Boucino [“petitioner”], an inmate at the Connecticut Correctional Institution at Somers, filed his petition for a writ of habeas corpus pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2254, alleging that the Connecticut alibi disclosure rules1 are unconstitutional on their face and as applied to petitioner, and that his double jeopardy rights were violated in his conviction for first-degree robbery, under Conn.Gen.Stat. § 53a-134(a)(4), and for first-degree larceny, under Conn. *224Gen.Stat. § 53a-122.2 Respondent Lawrence Tillman [“respondent”] filed his answer on April 17, 1991 (Dkt. # 8). On May 1,1991, respondent filed additional portions of petitioner’s state court record (Dkt. #9).3
On July 15, 1991, petitioner filed his motion for summary judgment, brief in support, and Local Rule 9(c) Statement4 (Dkt. ##13-15, 20-21). On August 19, 1991, respondent filed his cross-motion for summary judgment, brief in support, and Local Rule 9(c) Statement (Dkt. ## 16-18). For the reasons stated herein, petitioner’s motion for summary judgment is denied and respondent’s cross-motion for summary judgment is granted.
I. FACTUAL AND PROCEDURAL BACKGROUND
